1: The number 1 is the only number that is neither prime nor composite.
2: 2 is the only even prime number.
3: 3 is the first odd prime number.
4: There are 4 cardinal directions: North, South, East, and West.
5: 5 is the number of platonic solids: Tetrahedron, Cube, Octahedron, Dodecahedron, and Icosahedron
6: There are 6 faces on a standard cube.
7: The number 7 is often considered lucky in many cultures.
9: There are 9 planets in the Solar System (if you include Pluto).
10: There are 10 fingers on a pair of human hands.
11: The first Apollo mission to land on the Moon was Apollo 11.
12: There are 12 months in a year.
14: 14 is the atomic number of silicon.
15: The human body has 15 bones in the face.
16: There are 16 ounces in a pound.
17: The number 17 is considered unlucky in Italy.
18: In golf, a course typically has 18 holes.
19: 19 is the atomic number of potassium.
20: A standard game of darts has a target score of 20.
21: The legal drinking age in the US is 21.
22: There are 22 letters in the Hebrew alphabet.
23: 23 is the number of chromosomes in a human sperm or egg cell.
24: The number 24 is the number of hours in a day.
26: The alphabet has 26 letters in the English language.
28: There are 28 days in February in a common year.
29: Leap years have 29 days in February.
30: 30 is the number of degrees in each angle of an equilateral triangle.
31: 31 is the number of days in the longest months of the year.
32: 32 is the freezing point of water in Fahrenheit.
33: 33 is the atomic number of arsenic.
34: 34 is the 9th number in the Fibonacci sequence.
35: The human body has 35 liters of blood.
37: There are 37 different standard shoe sizes.
38: 38 is the number of games in an English Premier League season.
39: 39 is the atomic number of yttrium.
40: 40 is the number of weeks in a full-term human pregnancy.
41: 41 is the atomic number of niobium.
42: 42 is the answer to the ultimate question of life, the universe, and everything in The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy.
43: There are 43 muscles in the human face.
44: The number 44 is associated with balance in numerology.
45: 45 is the sum of the first nine prime numbers.
46: 46 is the number of chromosomes in a human cell.
47: 47 is the atomic number of silver.
48: 48 is the number of contiguous states in the USA.
50: There are 50 states in the United States of America.
51: Area 51 is a highly classified US Air Force facility
52: There are 52 weeks in a year.
53: 53 is the atomic number of iodine.
54: 54 is the number of countries in Africa.
55: 55 is the speed limit on many U.S. highways (in miles per hour).
56: 56 is the number of men who signed the U.S. Declaration of Independence.
57: 57 is the number of Heinz varieties.
58: 58 is the atomic number of cerium.
59: 59 is the smallest prime number that is the sum of 3 consecutive prime numbers (19, 17, and 23).
60: 60 is the number of seconds in a minute.
62: 62 is the atomic number of samarium.
63: 63 is the number of chromosomes in a horse (when paired).
64: 64 is the number of squares on a chessboard.
65: 65 is the age at which one traditionally retires.
66: 66 is the number of books in the Protestant Bible.
67: 67 is the atomic number of holmium.
68: 68 is often associated with the phrase 'do as you would be done by.'
70: The lifespan of a human is often rounded to 70 years in biblical terms.
71: 71 is the atomic number of lutetium.
72: 72 is the number of names on the Eiffel Tower.
74: 74 is the atomic number of tungsten.
75: 75 is the percentage of water on Earth’s surface.
76: 76 is the atomic number of osmium.
78: 78 is the atomic number of platinum.
79: 78 is the atomic number of gold.
80: 80 is the atomic number of mercury.
82: 82 is the number of games played by each team in a regular NHL season.
83: 83 is the atomic number of bismuth.
84: 84 is the number of years it takes Uranus to orbit the Sun.
85: 85 is the highest number used in the Postal Service's standard ZIP Code format.
86: There are 86 metals in the periodic table.
88: 88 is the number of keys on a piano.
90: 90 is the number of degrees in a right angle.
91: 91 is the number of characters in the longest English word without repeating letters: 'subdermatoglyphic.'
92: 92 is the number of counties in Indiana.
93: 93 million miles is roughly the distance from the Earth to the Sun.
94: The atomic number of plutonium is 94.
95: 95 is the speed limit on Germany’s autobahns.
97: 97 is the highest two-digit prime number.
98: 98 Degrees is a popular boy band from the '90s.
99: 99 is the number of red balloons in Nena’s famous '80s song.
